IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified overhead cables that need replacing, upgrading and raising to statutory height. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future, as we appreciate that you may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the cables. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Our contractors will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place on Goulds Road. A road closure will be in place to allow the works to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks with an important update regarding the planned power cut that was scheduled for tomorrow the 3rd of February 2026 in the CT3 postcode area. Our contractors have advised that the planned power cut has been cancelled. This is because some of our contractors are needing to support with the extensive damage caused to the electricity network in Portugal following Storm Kristin. These works have been re-scheduled to the 16th of February 2026, and we will confirm this in writing in due course. Our reference number for this is INCD-327230-U. We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the CT3 postcode area, then please call 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: This is the planned power cut that was originally scheduled for the 3rd of February 2026 but was cancelled because our contractors are needing to support with the extensive damage caused to the electricity network in Portugal following Storm Kristin. To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 2 spans of cables and 2 electricity poles that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Avidety will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place near Island Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Following a customer request we will be connecting a new substation to the electricity network. This equipment controls and delivers electricity into your area. To ensure our engineers can carry out this work safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Once completed this will provide the customer with their desired outcome as we have a duty to provide electricity when requested. This will also improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area and provide automation in the local area which will help with faster restoration times in the event of an unplanned fault. This work is taking place in the Avalon Road area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Brinkley Road in Westley Waterless.

Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so a tree surgeon can safely cut the trees away from 1 section of cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. This work is taking place near Cobbs Fenn.
MainMessage: The electricity supply to your premises may currently be affected by planned work.  You should have received a letter explaining this.  We hope to be able to restore your supplies by the planned time of 15:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this is causing.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 21:20 - Hi David here again. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue their investigations on the underground network in the CR5 4 and SM7 3 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 21:14 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 21:08 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 185 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 254 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 20:28. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 20:40 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Upminster Road South RM13 9 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault, which our engineers diverted power around.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Upminster Road South RM13 9 area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Adam at 20:23.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Is your power back on? We keep texting those signed up, and will continue to until the final 4 customers are restored. Want to stop receiving text updates? You will need to visit our website here - https://UKPN.short.gy/STOP to unsubscribe. Thank you.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 13:41 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repair a fault on the underground network in the Solent Road NW6 1 area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I wanted to let you know our staff have contacted us to advise they cannot restore your power safely from the substation.

The underground cable fault has now developed to such a point that our staff can locate it, and so we're arranging specialist engineering teams and a digging gang to pinpoint, excavate and repair it. It's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods, but it's also possible our time frame will need to change.

I'll let you know further news as soon as we get it, but if you have any concerns our team are always here on 08003163105. Sent by Decasta at 12:24.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 11:58 - We're sorry your power has gone off again today. Our engineers investigated the fault earlier but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Our engineers are still on site and using an average time frame, we are aiming to have all power back on between 15:00-16:00. We'll keep you updated with all of our progress.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 18:47 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the East Hill Road area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 18:13 - Our staff are on the way to the East Hill Road area as our safety equipment within the nearby substation has operated.

We believe a developing cable fault is causing these repeat power cuts, so while our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 22:30 and 23:30, it's possible this may need to change once staff have assessed. This is because every power cut increases the chance of the fault has developing to a point that our specialist teams can pinpoint it using specialist equipment. I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 19:03 - We can now confirm that all power in the Old Oak Common Lane area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Theo at 18:15.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Old Oak Common Lane area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 18:23 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 885 customers in the Ware, SG11 area by diverting power around the overhead network fault. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 17:47 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 885 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 221 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 20:00-21:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://UKPN.short.gy/STOP to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
